title: 114_hr4230
content: The Act may be cited as the "Stonewall National Historic Site Establishment Act" and its purpose is outlined in the findings. The Stonewall National Historic Landmark in New York City commemorates the 1969 uprising that inspired the modern LGBT civil rights movement in America. It represents the struggle for LGBT civil rights and consists of the former Stonewall Inn and Christopher Park. The Stonewall National Historic Landmark in New York City commemorates the 1969 uprising at locations associated with the event. The Act aims to preserve the site and enhance understanding of LGBT discrimination and civil rights struggles. SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS. This Act defines key terms such as "National Historic Site" as the Stonewall National Historic Site in New York City, "Map" as the proposed boundary map, "City" as the government of New York City, "Secretary" as the Secretary of the Interior, and "State" as the State of New York. The Stonewall National Historic Site is established in the State as a unit of the National Park System, subject to conditions for establishment including land acquisition and written agreements with the City. The boundary of the National Historic Site is defined. The National Historic Site boundary aligns with the Stonewall National Historic Landmark. A map is available for public inspection. The Secretary can make agreements with the City for site operation. A notice of establishment must be published in the Federal Register within 60 days. The National Historic Site, part of the National Park System, allows land acquisition for park facilities. The Secretary administers the site according to relevant laws. The Secretary may enter into cooperative agreements with entities to further the purposes of the Act, with a cost-sharing requirement not exceeding 50% federal share. The Federal share of the cost for activities may be in the form of in-kind contributions or goods/services. The Secretary, in consultation with the City, must prepare a general management plan for the National Historic Site within 3 years of funds availability.
